This course fulfills a single unit in each of the  following BU Hub areas: Historical Consciousness, Philosophical Inquiry and  Life's Meanings, Critical Thinking."

column3: The History of Medicine in Ancient Greece and Rome
column4: b'period. It examines developments in  anatomy, pharmacology, psychology and nutrition, and analyzes texts by  important ancient medical thinkers. Cannot be taken for credit in addition to  the course with the same name that was previously numbered CAS CL 328. This  course fulfills a single unit in each of the following BU Hub areas: Historical  Consciousness, Social Inquiry I, Research and Information Literacy.'
